Posts.Content: queeny209 wrote: My mom has had her first chemo session about a week ago and has been actually fending pretty well. Before the chemo she had a lumpectomy. the incision has been okay, but today she woke up and the incision is red, inflamed, painful, and swollen. Because she is undergoing chemotherapy, i feel like she should go to the hospital right away. am i overreacting? or should she wait until the weekends over. Dx 9/1/2012, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, ER-/PR+, HER2+ Surgery 9/13/2012 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left Targeted Therapy 10/9/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 10/9/2012 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: incision is red and swollen and i'm having chemo? queeny209 Marple
